TunableList.name: _apply_on_load_tags
TunableList.description: A set of tags that are are compared to interaction tags that the sim was running when they became uninstantiated. If there are any matching tags then this away action will be applied automatically to that sim rather than the default away action.

TunableEnum.description: A single tag that will be compared to the interaction tags.

Tunable.name: _available_when_instanced
Tunable.description: If this away action is able to be applied when the sim is still instanced. If the sim becomes instanced while the away action is running we will not stop running it. This should only be true in special cases such as with careers. PLEASE ASK A GPE ABOUT MAKING THIS TRUE BEFORE DOING SO. YOU PROBABLY DON'T WANT THIS.

TdescFragTag.name: _disable_away_action
TdescFragTag.description: The availability of this away action based on tests.

TunableVariant.name: _disabled_when_running
TunableVariant.description: The availability of this away action when it is already the active away action on the sim.

Tunable.name: disabled_when_running
Tunable.description: The text that displays in the tooltip string when this away action is not available because it is already the active away action.

Tunable.name: _display_name
Tunable.description: The name given to the away action when the user sees it in the pie menu.

TunableTuple.name: _display_name_text_tokens
TunableTuple.description: Localization tokens to be passed into 'display_name'. For example, you could use a participant or you could also pass in statistic and commodity values

TunableList.name: tokens
TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

TunableTuple.name: animal_home
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the animal home.

TunableVariant.name: animal_home_data
TunableVariant.description: Data you'd like to fetch about the animal home.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch specified data. This is expected to resolve to an Animal Home.

TunableTuple.name: associated_club
TunableTuple.description: The token is a stored 'associated_club' on this interaction. Only works with ClubMixerInteractions or ClubSuperInteractions.

TunableTuple.name: buck_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number repesenting the amount of the specified buck type the specified participant has.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

TunableTuple.name: buff_duration_remaining
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the remaining duration of a buff

Tunable.name: buff
Tunable.description: The buff whose duration we want to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified buff duration.

TunableTuple.name: career_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized string, number, or Sim, representing the specified career data for the specified participant.

TunableVariant.name: career_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

Tunable.name: career_type
Tunable.description: The career we care about.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's whose career data we care about.

TunableTuple.name: civic_policy
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the Civic Policy system.

TunableVariant.name: civic_policy_data
TunableVariant.description: The specific value to display.

TunableTuple.name: definition
TunableTuple.description: A catalog definition to use as a token. This is useful if you want to properly localize an object's name or description.

TunableTuple.name: game_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized number or Sim representing the specified game component data from game component.

TunableVariant.name: game_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's from whom the game component data we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: gig_history
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display data from gig history.

TunableVariant.name: customer_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the participant representing the customer in gig history. If disabled, falls back to searching for any valid gig in history.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: TargetSim searches for provided customer sim. Lot will search for the current lot.

TunableVariant.name: gig_history_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: max_gig_result
TunableEnum.description: The worst acceptable gig result to find.

TunableEnum.name: min_gig_result
TunableEnum.description: The worst acceptable gig result to find.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose gig history we will search.

TunableTuple.name: global_policy
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display data from the tuned global policy.

Tunable.name: global_policy
Tunable.description: The global policy from which data is displayed.

TunableEnum.name: token_property
TunableEnum.description: Which property from the Global Policy Token to use. NAME will use the policy's display name, PROGRESS will use the progress made over the max progress value.

TunableTuple.name: lifestyle_brand
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a Lifestyle Brand owned by a Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who owns the lifestyle brand.

TunableTuple.name: luck
TunableTuple.description: Token for a sim's Luck level.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who's luck level we want to display.

TunableTuple.name: money_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the amount of Simoleons that were awarded in loot to the specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for whom we fetch the earned amount of money.

TunableTuple.name: object_fashion_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the object fashion marketplace component and fashion marketplace system.

TunableVariant.name: object_fashion_marketplace_data
TunableVariant.description: Please select what value you would like to use.

TunableTuple.name: object_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the object marketplace component and marketplace system.

TunableVariant.name: object_marketplace_data
TunableVariant.description: Please select what value you would like to use.

TunableTuple.name: object_property
TunableTuple.description: The token is a property of a game object. This could be catalog properties like its price or its rarity which is a property given by a component.

TunableEnum.name: obj_property
TunableEnum.description: The property of the object that we will request.

TunableTuple.name: object_state_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string representing the value of a specific state from the selected participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified state's value.

Tunable.name: state
Tunable.description: The state's whose value we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: participant_count
TunableTuple.description: The number of participants of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableList.name: by_set_of_references
TunableList.description: A set of references that the objects should be in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type
TunableTuple.description: The token is a Sim or object participant from the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: formatter
TunableVariant.description: Define the format for this token.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableList.name: by_set_of_references
TunableList.description: A set of references that the objects should be in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type_special
TunableTuple.description: The token is a specified string grabbed from a supported participant type that requires special handling. Currently supported are: I. Participants that resolve into households 1. Household Name 2. Household Description 2. Participants that resolve into zone ids 1. Lot Name 2. Lot Description 3. Name of household that lives there 4. Description of household that lives there.

TunableTuple.name: household
TunableTuple.description: Helper class used to support participants that resolve into households.

TunableVariant.name: attribute
TunableVariant.description: Which string we are interested in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Participant that resolves to a household.

TunableTuple.name: zone
TunableTuple.description: Helper class used to support participants that resolve into zone ids.

TunableVariant.name: attribute
TunableVariant.description: Which string we are interested in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Participant that resolves to zone id of a multi unit business.

TunableTuple.name: picked_part
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a picked part.

TunableTuple.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token can be used to get strings representing scholarship information from the scholarship letter component of an object.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom to get the scholarship letter component data.

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: sickness
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the sickness on the specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who is sick.

TunableTuple.name: small_business
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the small business owned by specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who has small business.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the value of a specific statistic from the selected participant.

Tunable.name: clamp_value_to_floor
Tunable.description: If True, the value will be clamped to its floor.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic's whose value we want to fetch.

Tunable.name: use_statistic_name
Tunable.description: If True, the value will be the name of the statistic.

TunableTuple.name: street
TunableTuple.description: Using the Street Selector tuning, provide a token localization appropriate street selection.

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get the street participant.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableList.name: _exit_conditions
TunableList.description: A list of exit conditions for this away action. When met will, apply a SimInfo.DEFAULT_AWAY_ACTION or, if tuned, the override default away action.

TunableList.name: conditions
TunableList.description: A list of conditions that all must be satisfied for the group to be considered satisfied.

TunableVariant.description: A condition for an away action.

Tunable.name: absolute
Tunable.description: True = treat the threshold value as an absolute commodity value. Otherwise, it is relative to the Sim's start value.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The commodity we are gaining.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: A commodity value and comparison that defines the exit condition hits (or hit commodity.maximum).

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableTuple.name: time_based
TunableTuple.description: The minimum and maximum amount of time required to satisfy this condition.

Tunable.name: max_time
Tunable.description: Maximum amount of time (in sim minutes) for this condition to be satisfied.

Tunable.name: min_time
Tunable.description: Minimum amount of time (in sim minutes) for this condition to be satisfied.

TunableTuple.name: _periodic_stat_changes
TunableTuple.description: Periodic stat changes that this away action applies while it is active.

TunableList.name: operations
TunableList.description: A list of statistic operations that occur at each interval.

TunableTuple.name: dynamic_skill
TunableTuple.description: Dynamically adds to the defined skill.

TunableTuple.name: skill_loot_data_override
TunableTuple.description: This data will override loot data in the interaction. In interaction, tuning field 'skill_loot_data' is used to determine skill loot data.

TunableEnum.name: effectiveness
TunableEnum.description: Enum to determine which curve to use when giving points to sim.

TunableVariant.name: level_range
TunableVariant.description: Interval is used to clamp the sim's user facing skill level to determine how many point to give. If disabled, level passed to the dynamic skill loot will always be the current user facing skill level of sim. Example: if sim is level 7 in fitness but interaction skill level is only for 1 to 5 give the dynamic skill amount as if sim is level 5.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Interval is used to clamp the sim's user facing skill level to determine how many point to give. If disabled, level passed to the dynamic skill loot will always be the current user facing skill level of sim. Example: if sim is level 7 in fitness but interaction skill level is only for 1 to 5 give the dynamic skill amount as if sim is level 5.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: dynamic_variant_skill
TunableTuple.description: Grabs a skill from another source of tuning and dynamically adds to it.

TunableTuple.name: skill_loot_data
TunableTuple.description: The reference to the skill data.

TunableEnum.name: effectiveness
TunableEnum.description: Enum to determine which curve to use when giving points to sim.

TunableVariant.name: level_range
TunableVariant.description: Interval is used to clamp the sim's user facing skill level to determine how many point to give. If disabled, level passed to the dynamic skill loot will always be the current user facing skill level of sim. Example: if sim is level 7 in fitness but interaction skill level is only for 1 to 5 give the dynamic skill amount as if sim is level 5.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Interval is used to clamp the sim's user facing skill level to determine how many point to give. If disabled, level passed to the dynamic skill loot will always be the current user facing skill level of sim. Example: if sim is level 7 in fitness but interaction skill level is only for 1 to 5 give the dynamic skill amount as if sim is level 5.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: stat
TunableVariant.description: Where to obtain the statistic we are operating on.

TunableTuple.name: from_career
TunableTuple.description: TunableFactory for specifying the career to get the statistic from for the TunableSkillLootData

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description: The career to reference a statistic from.

TunableTuple.name: from_picked
TunableTuple.description: TunableFactory for getting the picked statistic from the TunableSkillLootData

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_change
TunableTuple.description: Adds to the relationship score statistic for this Super Interaction

TunableVariant.TunableTuple: <TunableTuple name="track_range" class="TunableInterval" display="Track Range" description="The relationship track must > lower_bound and <= upper_bound for the operation to apply." group="General">

TunableTuple.name: statistic_change
TunableTuple.description: Modify the value of a statistic.

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: The gain, per interval for this operation.

TunableVariant.name: maximum
TunableVariant.description: A variant containing the different ways you can cap the max amount a statistic reaches as result of a change.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: The max amount of points that a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_points
Tunable.description: The point total that a stat cannot go above when increasing. If the increase would go above this point total, instead it will just be equal to this point total.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: The max rank a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_rank
Tunable.description: The rank that a stat cannot go beyond when increasing. If the increase would go beyond achieving this rank, instead it will be set to the min points required to meet this rank. This will prevent any gains toward the next rank from occurring. NOTE: Must be used with a RankedStatistic or it will return 0 as the max.

TunableVariant.name: object_cost_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: When enabled allows you to multiply the stat gain amount based on the value of the object specified.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on the value/cost of an object.

TunableList.name: multiplier_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The value of the subject in simoleons is used. This means that a curve for cost should have value at its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The object whose cost you want to base the multiplier on.

TunableEnum.name: periodic_change_behavior
TunableEnum.description: When applying this change operation at the beginning of an interaction as part of a periodic statistic change and statistic is a continuous statistic, tune the behavior of this operation when interaction begins. Terminology: BaseBehavior: For change operations that succeed chance and test or if chance is 100% or no tests, the statistic stores the start time and when interaction ends determine how much time is passed and multiply amount. Continuous statistic WILL NOT decay with this behavior. This is for better performance. IntervalBehavior: If continuous statistic is using interval behavior. the amount tuned will be given at specified interval if chance and tests succeeds. Continuous statistics WILL decay between interval time. Tuning Behavior APPLY_AT_START_ONLY: If chance and tests for change operation is successful, periodic update will occur and follow BaseBehavior. If either fail, change operation is not given at any point. RETEST_ON_INTERVAL: If test and chance succeeds, then this will follow BaseBehavior. If test or chance fails, this operation will follow interval behavior. APPLY_AT_INTERVAL_ONLY: This will strictly follow Interval Behavior.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TunableList.name: statistic_multipliers
TunableList.description: Tunables for adding statistic based multipliers to the payout in the format: amount *= statistic.value

TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on a statistical value.

TunableVariant.name: multiplier
TunableVariant.description: Define how the multiplier will be applied.

TunableList.name: value_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The user-value is used. This means that a curve for skills should have levels as its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The payout amount will be multiplied by this statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant to look for the specified statistic on.

TunableList.name: subject
TunableList.description: The owner of the stat that we are operating on.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableList.name: tunable_multipliers
TunableList.description: List of multipliers to be applied when gaining amount

TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a total multiplier value based on tunable tests.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_change_by_category
TunableTuple.description: Change value of all statistics of a specific category.

Tunable.name: percent_change_amount
Tunable.description: Percent of current value of statistic should amount be changed. If you want to decrease the amount by 50% enter -50% into the tuning field.

Tunable.name: change_amout
Tunable.description: Amount of change to be applied to statistics that match category.

TunableEnum.name: statistic_category
TunableEnum.description: The category of commodity to remove.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableList.name: _preroll_commodities
TunableList.description: A list of commodities that will be used to run preroll if the sim loaded with this away action.

Tunable.description: The commodity that is used to solve for preroll if the sim had this away action on them when they are being loaded. This is used to help preserve the fiction of what that sim was doing when the player returns to the lot. EX: make the sim garden if they were using the gardening away action.

TunableList.name: _preroll_static_commodities
TunableList.description: A list of static commodities that will be used to run preroll if the sim loaded with this away action.

Tunable.description: The static commodity that is used to solve for preroll if the sim had this away action on them when they are being loaded. This is used to help preserve the fiction of what that sim was doing when the player returns to the lot. EX: make the sim garden if they were using the gardening away action.

TdescFragTag.name: _tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that determine if this away action is applicable. These tests do not ensure that the conditions are still met throughout the duration that the away action is applied.

TunableVariant.name: icon_data
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, the icon and tooltip that represents the away action on the sim skewer.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The icon and tooltip that represents the away action on the sim skewer.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: Icon that represents the away action on the sim skewer.

Tunable.name: tooltip
Tunable.description: The tooltip shown on the icon that represents the away action.

TunableList.name: mood_list
TunableList.description: A list of possible moods this AwayAction may associate with.

Tunable.description: A mood associated with this AwayAction.

TunableVariant.name: override_default_away_action
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this away action will override the returned action, if any, from the SimInfo.DEFAULT_AWAY_ACTION mapping. If no override is specified, and an exit condition is tuned, you have to add or ensure that the sim will fall into one of the mappings in SimInfo.DEFAULT_AWAY_ACTION, else the away action UI will disappear when the exit condition is satisfied.

Tunable.name: use_override
Tunable.description: The away action to run.

Tunable.name: use_sim_info_default_away_action
Tunable.display: Use Sim Info Default Away Action

Tunable.name: pie_menu_tooltip
Tunable.description: The tooltip shown in the pie menu for this away action.
